text: James John Bailey (21 July 1929 - 31 March 2020) was an Australian middle- distance runner. He reached the semifinals of the 800 metres event at the 1956 Summer Olympics. While running for the University of Oregon under Bill Bowerman, he was the 1955 NCAA Champion in the mile. He was born in Sydney and grew up in Parkes, New South Wales. Bailey lived in Bellingham, Washington, United States. He died in hospice care on 31 March 2020 at the age of 90. ==References== ==Other websites== *Jim Bailey at Sports-Reference.com Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:1956 Summer Olympics Category:Australian athletes Category:Olympians for Australia Category:Middle- distance runners Category:Sportspeople from Sydney
title: Jim Bailey (athlete)
